intro: Dicoelia sumatrana, commonly known as the Sumatran dicoelia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
